markdownRemark.html:
Recently I’ve spent some time on CUDA programming and implementing custom Ops for TensorFlow. As an exercise, I decided to take a shot at implementing a custom Op for one of the operations in capsule networks that would normally require some reshape hacking or at least a couple of intermediate TensorFlow Ops. If you’re not familiar with Capsule Networks, have a look at the original paper or my previous post. The open-sourced capsule network code by the authors can be found here. The code that we discuss in this blog post can be found here.

Many of the concepts that are covered in this post (CUDA, TensorFlow custom Ops, gradient testing) can be learned by going through their corresponding documentations, but I always think it is enlightening to see how such separate elements come together. This is the main motivation behind my blog post: showcasing the development of a custom TensorFlow Op with CUDA from start to end. So let’s commence.

EDIT There also exists a Chinese translation of this post by Jakukyo Friel.
